message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper discusses the design of algorithms for local differential privacy (LDP) for analytical tasks, which falls under the category of privacy-preserving data analysis. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the use of LDP for data sharing and analytics, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DB (Databases). The paper also discusses the trade-off between utility and privacy, which is a common theme in machine learning and data mining, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses the use of policies to customize privacy guarantees, which is related to information theory, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.IT (Information Theory).
